title: US Senate poised to take first steps to end 40-day shutdown
byline: The United States Senate is voting on the first steps to end the 40-day government shutdown Sunday after a group of moderate Democrats agreed to proceed without a guaranteed extension of health care subsidies, angering many in their caucus who wanted to continue the fight.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m., today (10), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: 2025 GCE A/L exam to begin today at over 2,300 centres
byline: The 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination is scheduled to commence today at 2,362 examination centres across the island, with 340,525 candidates expected to sit for the exams.

title: Top BBC bosses resign after criticism of the broadcaster’s editing of a Trump speech
byline: The head of the BBC and the British broadcaster’s top news executive both resigned Sunday after criticism of the way the organization edited a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Second day of 2026 Budget debate to begin today
byline: The second day of the debate on the Second Reading of the Appropriation Bill for the year 2026 is scheduled to commence today (10).

title: Philippines hit by ‘intense’ typhoon as nearly a million evacuate
byline: Typhoon Fung-wong has made landfall in the Philippines, where more than 900,000 people have been evacuated and two people have died.

title: Salman Rushdie is being honored with a Dayton peace prize lifetime achievement award
byline: Salman Rushdie was among the honorees Sunday at the Dayton Literary Peace Prize event in Ohio, receiving a lifetime achievement award after publishing his first work of fiction since being stabbed on a New York lecture stage three years ago.

title: Man dies after on-field accident during cricket match in Minuwangoda
byline: A 41-year-old man has reportedly died following an accident during a cricket match at a playground in the Aluthepola area of Minuwangoda.

title: Steering Committee to be established to digitize healthcare service in Sri Lanka
byline: A special discussion was held under the patronage of the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Nalinda Jayatissa on the establishment of a Steering Committee to digitally transform Sri Lanka’s free healthcare system.

title: US Senate advances bill to end federal shutdown
byline: The U.S. Senate on Sunday moved forward on a measure aimed at reopening the federal government and ending a now 40-day shutdown that has sidelined federal workers, delayed food aid and snarled air travel.

title: Over 1,200 arrested in nationwide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 1,284 suspects were arrested during 1,000 island-wide raids conducted within yesterday (10) under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Prisons Dept. launches probe into viral video on social media
byline: The Department of Prisons has initiated an investigation into a video circulating widely on social media, which appears to show an inmate reportedly identified as a notorious underworld figure, freely using a mobile phone within a prison premises.

title: Indonesia grants national hero status to late strongman President Suharto
byline: Indonesia awarded the title of national hero on Monday (Nov 10) to late President Suharto, who was forced out of office in 1998 by violent protests that ended a three-decade rule marred by accusations of mass human rights violations, corruption and nepotism.

title: Ex-Minister Keheliya, wife and daughter arrive at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his wife and a daughter have appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (10).

title: Three workers including 2 Sri Lankans found dead at fish farm in South Korea
byline: Three workers were found dead at a land-based fish farm in Goseong, South Gyeongsang Province, in South Korea, prompting a police investigation.

title: ADB approves $100 million to strengthen macroeconomic resilience, transparency in Sri Lanka
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved a $100 million financing package to build on Sri Lanka’s progress toward macroeconomic stability and to help achieve sustainable growth following the economic crisis.

title: Private bus overturns in Thalawa, injuring 20 persons including children
byline: Around 20 people have sustained injuries in an accident that occurred when a private bus overturned at the Jayaganga Junction of Thalawa, Anuradhapura, the Police Media Division stated.

title: Farmers stage protest, halt agricultural activities citing 2026 Budget neglect
byline: Farmers across several areas, including Welimada and Uva Paranagama, have withdrawn from agricultural activities today (10), alleging that the government has failed to provide reasonable solutions to their issues and that the 2026 Budget has neglected the agricultural sector.

title: Petition filed against operation to drive wild elephants into reserves dismissed
byline: The Court of Appeal today (10) dismissed without hearing a writ petition filed by the Vinivida Foundation, seeking to suspend the ongoing operation by wildlife authorities to drive away wild elephants that have entered villages into forest reserves in Hambantota.

title: Six sentenced to death over 2015 double murder in Padiyathalawa
byline: The Ampara High Court today (10) sentenced six individuals to death in connection with a murder that took place on April 14, 2015.

title: Thalawa Bus Accident: Five dead, nearly 40 injured
byline: An individual has been confirmed to have died while about 40 others have been injured in the bus accident reported in Thalawa, Anuradhapura, police stated.

title: Several injured in bus-lorry accident on Buttala-Monaragala road
byline: Several individuals have sustained injuries when a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) collided with a lorry at the eleventh post area on the Buttala - Monaragala main road this afternoon (10).

title: 2024 Auditor General’s annual report handed over to Speaker
byline: The Annual Report of the Auditor General for the year 2024 has been handed over to the Speaker of House, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne by the Acting Auditor General, G.H.D. Dharmapala, at the Parliamentary Complex.

title: 14 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: Fourteen Indian fishermen accused of poaching in Sri Lankan territorial waters have been arrested in seas off Northern province, the Sri Lanka Navy said.

title: Hundreds turn out for anti-pollution protest in Delhi
byline: Hundreds of people in Delhi took to the streets on Sunday to protest against pollution as air quality continues to worsen in India’s capital and surrounding areas.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayake’s writ petition to be taken up in Jan.
byline: The Court of Appeal today ordered that the writ petition filed by Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake —seeking an order preventing his arrest by police over an incident that occurred within the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court premises—be taken up once again on January 14, 2026.

title: US flight delays, cancellations accelerate as air traffic controller shortages surge
byline: Hundreds of thousands of travelers had their flights delayed or canceled on Sunday in the worst day for disruptions since the start of a U.S. government shutdown, as Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy warned of worse to come in the run-up to the Thanksgiving holiday.

title: Consignment of perfumes worth Rs. 100 million smuggled from Dubai seized
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has seized a consignment of perfumes worth around Rs. 100 million that were illegally brought into the country.

title: A/L paper marking could begin before the completion of exam: Exams Chief
byline: A decision has been taken to paper marking activities before the conclusion of the 2025 General Certificate of Education (GCE) Advanced Level (A/L) examination, the Department of Examinations has stated.

title: Thailand suspends Cambodia ‘peace deal’
byline: Thailand says it is suspending the implementation its “peace deal” with neighbouring Cambodia over a disputed border - just two weeks after Donald Trump presided over its signing.

title: Thalawa Bus Accident: One dead, nearly 40 injured
byline: An individual has been confirmed to have died while about 40 others have been injured in the bus accident reported in Thalawa, Anuradhapura, police stated.

title: Eight dead in explosion near Delhi’s Red Fort Metro Station
byline: A powerful explosion near the Red Fort metro station at India’s capital Delhi on Monday evening killed at least eight people and injured several others, officials said.

title: Sri Lanka to send 3,500 on Hajj pilgrimage in 2026
byline: The government of Sri Lanka has signed the agreement for the 2026 Hajj pilgrimage with Saudi Arabian officials in Jeddah, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Namal Rajapaksa visits SLFP headquarters for the first time in ten years
byline: A group from the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), including its National Organizer Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa visited the headquarters of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) today (10) — for the first time in nearly ten years.

title: Tourist arrivals in November top 60,000
byline: A total of 61,890 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in November, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Nepal police arrest more than 400 over September protests
byline: Nepal’s police have arrested 423 people accused of crimes ranging from murder to vandalism during a deadly mass uprising in September that toppled the government, according to police data released on Monday.

title: Driver of bus involved in Thalawa accident arrested
byline: The driver of the private bus involved in this morning’s accident in Thalawa, Anuradhapura has been arrested, police stated.

title: Man arrested in operation against mangrove destruction in Wanathawilluwa
byline: Puttalam wildlife officers have arrested an individual during an operation conducted to apprehend a group involved in the destruction of mangroves in Wattakkandal, Wanathawilluwa.

title: Sri Lanka supports ‘Riyadh Declaration on Future of Tourism’
byline: The government of Sri Lanka has extended its support to the “Riyadh Declaration on the Future of Tourism” at the 26th Session of the United Nations World Tourism Organization General Assembly in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

title: India-Sri Lanka military exercise ‘Mitra Shakti’ begins in Karnataka
byline: India and Sri Lanka today (10) kick-started a two-week military exercise in Karnataka’s Belagavi as part of efforts to enhance interoperability, PTI reported.
